title: Systematic Learning Path for Beginners
summary: A 0-12 month roadmap balancing racket skills and footwork progression.
goals: Develop hands and legs in parallel.
Progress through phases with clear focus.

structure.title: Phase 1: The Foundation (0-3 months)
items: Grip mastery: neutral grip, thumb grip, smooth transitions.
Net play basics: net lift and net shot contact point.
Basic service: low serve and high serve mechanics.
Ready position and split step base.
Front court movement: lunge, chasse + lunge, recovery.
Split step timing on opponent contact.

structure.title: Phase 2: Overhead Basics & Rear Court (3-6 months)
items: Overhead forehand: high clear with pronation and high contact point.
Drop shot with the same preparation as clear.
Basic smash: standing accuracy before power.
Rear court movement: scissor kick, backward chasse, optional China jump.
Mid-court movement and flow between front and rear.

structure.title: Phase 3: Advanced Skills & Tactics (6-12 months)
items: Advanced net game: cross-court net shots and net kill.
Deception: consistent preparation for clear, drop, smash; slicing.
